intro: Hymenandra narayanaswamii, commonly known as the Narayanaswami's hymenandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
